ingredients.item: 500g pork loin or kasim, thinly sliced

instructions.step: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, sugar, pepper, and salt to make the marinade.
Add pork slices and mix well. Cover and marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry marinated pork slices until browned and cooked through.
Serve hot with garlic fried rice and fried egg for a complete meal.
In a large bowl, mix ground pork with salt, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, pepper, and garlic until well combined.
Cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours.
If using casings, stuff the mixture into cleaned sausage casings and twist into links. Otherwise, shape into patties or leave loose.
To cook, add a bit of water to a pan with the longganisa. Simmer until water evaporates, then fry in its own fat or a little oil until browned.
Serve hot with garlic fried rice and egg (longsilog).

ingredients.item: 1 kg beef tripe (tuwalya), cleaned and cut into strips

instructions.step: In a large pot, sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in annatto oil until fragrant.
Add the beef and tripe. Cook until lightly browned.
Pour in water or beef broth. Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer until meat and tripe are tender (about 1.5 to 2 hours).
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice and calamansi or vinegar on the side.

ingredients.item: 300g pork belly or pork kasim, sliced thinly
1 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water (slurry)
Chicharon, fried garlic, and spring onions for garnish

instructions.step: Heat oil in a pan. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork belly and cook until lightly browned. Add liver and cook briefly.
Season with soy sauce, fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Pour in the broth and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Add the miki noodles and cook for another 5 minutes.
Pour in the cornstarch slurry while stirring to thicken the soup.
Slowly add the beaten egg while stirring to create egg strands.
Top with chicharon, fried garlic, and spring onions before serving. Serve hot.
In a bowl, mix vinegar, garlic, pepper, and salt to make the marinade.
Place the bangus in a shallow dish or ziplock bag and pour in the marinade. Marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.
Drain the bangus and pat dry.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry the bangus skin-side down first until golden brown and crispy. Flip and cook the other side.
Serve hot with garlic fried rice and egg (bangsilog), and a side of sliced tomatoes or spiced vinegar.

ingredients.item: 1 cup kapeng barako (Batangas coffee), freshly brewed
Butter, cheese, or jam (optional spread for pandesal)
Condensed milk or sugar (optional, for coffee)

instructions.step: Warm the pandesal in an oven or toaster for a few minutes, if desired.
Brew kapeng barako using a coffee press, percolator, or traditional cloth strainer (katsa).
Serve the warm pandesal with your choice of spread like butter, cheese, or jam.
Serve kapeng barako black or sweetened with sugar or condensed milk, according to taste.
Enjoy this classic Filipino breakfast pairing hot.

ingredients.item: 6 pcs fresh tawilis (freshwater sardines), cleaned and scaled
1/2 cup all-purpose flour (optional, for light coating)
Vinegar with garlic and chili (for dipping)

instructions.step: Rinse the tawilis thoroughly and pat dry with paper towels.
Season with salt and pepper. Optional: Lightly coat with flour for extra crispiness.
Heat oil in a deep pan over medium-high heat.
Fry the tawilis in batches until golden brown and crispy, about 3-5 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Serve hot with vinegar dipping sauce and steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup tablea (pure cacao tablets) or 1/4 cup cocoa powder
Evaporated or condensed milk for topping

instructions.step: In a pot, bring water to a boil. Add glutinous rice and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
Once the rice begins to soften, add tablea or cocoa powder. Stir until fully dissolved and well mixed.
Add sugar and a pinch of salt. Simmer until the mixture thickens and rice is fully cooked.
Adjust sweetness to taste, then remove from heat.
In a separate pan, fry tuyo until crispy. Remove scales and bones if desired.
Serve champorado hot in bowls, topped with milk and paired with fried tuyo on the side.

ingredients.item: 2 cups glutinous rice (malagkit), soaked for 2 hours and drained
Banana leaves, wilted and cut into wrapping-size pieces

instructions.step: In a mixing bowl, combine soaked glutinous rice and lihiya. Mix until rice is evenly coated.
Scoop 2–3 tablespoons of the mixture and place in the center of a banana leaf. Shape into a log and wrap tightly. Tie with string to secure.
Place the wrapped suman in a large pot. Add enough water to cover and boil for 1.5 to 2 hours or until cooked and tender.
Meanwhile, in a separate pan, simmer coconut cream over medium heat until oil separates and golden brown latik forms. Stir occasionally to prevent burning. Set aside.
Once suman is cooked, let it cool slightly. Serve with latik and sugar on top, if desired.
In a bowl, combine glutinous rice flour and water to form a soft dough. Roll into small balls to make bilo-bilo.
In a pot, combine coconut milk and sugar. Bring to a gentle boil over medium heat.
Add sweet potatoes and cook until halfway tender.
Add bananas and jackfruit. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Gently drop in the rice balls (bilo-bilo) and cook until they float, about 5–7 minutes.
Stir in cooked sago and coconut cream. Add salt and adjust sweetness as needed. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Serve warm in bowls as a comforting merienda or dessert.

ingredients.item: 1.5 kg beef shank with bone marrow
1 large corn on the cob, cut into chunks
Green onions and peppercorns for garnish

instructions.step: In a large pot, combine beef shank, onion, garlic, and water. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 2–3 hours or until meat is tender.
Skim off any scum that forms on the surface while cooking.
Add corn and simmer for another 30 minutes until corn is tender.
Add cabbage and cook for 5–7 minutes until just tender.
Season broth with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions and whole peppercorns.

ingredients.item: 1 kg tulingan (mackerel tuna), cleaned and gutted

instructions.step: Layer banana leaves at the bottom of a pot.
Place the tulingan fish inside the pot. Sprinkle salt evenly over the fish.
Add water and bay leaves (and ginger if using).
Cover the pot and simmer over low heat for about 2 to 3 hours, allowing the fish to cook slowly and absorb the flavors.
Check occasionally to ensure there is enough liquid to prevent burning, adding more water if necessary.
Serve hot with steamed rice and dipping vinegar.

ingredients.item: 1 kg pork belly or chicken, cut into serving pieces
1 thumb-sized turmeric (luyang dilaw), grated or sliced

instructions.step: Heat oil in a pot. Sauté garlic and turmeric until fragrant.
Add pork or chicken pieces and brown on all sides.
Pour in vinegar, soy sauce, coconut milk, bay leaves, and peppercorns. Do not stir immediately.
Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until meat is tender.
Season with salt to taste. If sauce is too thin, simmer uncovered to reduce.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg beef chuck or brisket, cut into cubes

instructions.step: Heat oil in a pot. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef cubes and brown on all sides.
Pour in soy sauce and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato sauce, beef broth, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 1.5 to 2 hours or until beef is tender.
Add potatoes, carrots, liver spread, and green peas. Cook until vegetables are tender and sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove bay leaf before serving.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg beef short ribs (tadyang ng baka), cut into serving pieces
1 medium green papaya or chayote, peeled and sliced
1 bunch chili leaves (or malunggay leaves as substitute)

instructions.step: Heat oil in a large pot. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add beef ribs and brown slightly.
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours or until meat is tender.
Add fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Add green papaya or chayote and cook until tender.
Stir in chili leaves just before turning off the heat.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 150g pork belly or pork shoulder, diced

instructions.step: In a pot, boil mung beans in water or pork broth until soft, about 30-40 minutes. Mash slightly if desired.
In a separate pan, heat oil and sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes until fragrant and softened.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Pour sautéed mixture into the pot with mung beans. Stir well.
Add fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
Add spinach or moringa leaves and cook until wilted.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Heat oil in a pot and sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Pour in vinegar and allow to simmer for a few minutes without stirring.
Add water and fish sauce, then simmer until pork is tender, about 30 minutes.
Slowly pour in pork blood while stirring gently to prevent curdling.
Season with salt, pepper, and optional chili peppers.
Simmer for another 10 minutes until the blood thickens and the flavors meld.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: Banana leaves or foil for grilling

instructions.step: Make diagonal slashes on the tilapia to allow marinade to penetrate.
In a bowl, mix coconut milk, garlic, ginger, onion, chili, fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Marinate the tilapia in the coconut milk mixture for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill. Wrap each tilapia in banana leaves or aluminum foil.
Grill the fish over medium heat for about 20-25 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve hot with steamed rice and drizzle with remaining coconut sauce.

ingredients.item: 1 kg beef brisket or shank, cut into cubes
2 cups peanut butter or ground peanuts
1 cup cooked kidney beans (or garbanzo beans)
1 cup string beans (sitaw), cut into 2-inch pieces
2 tbsp annatto powder (achuete) dissolved in 1/4 cup water

instructions.step: Heat oil in a pot. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef cubes and brown on all sides.
Add beef broth, bay leaves, and simmer until beef is tender, about 1.5 to 2 hours.
Stir in peanut butter and annatto water. Mix well to create the sauce.
Add kidney beans, eggplant, and string beans. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Simmer for another 10 minutes to blend flavors.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 500g dried taro leaves (dahon ng gabi), washed and drained
4 pieces dried red chili peppers (siling labuyo)

instructions.step: Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add pork belly and cook until browned.
Pour in shrimp paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Layer taro leaves on top without stirring. Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes.
Pour in coconut cream and add dried chili peppers. Stir gently to combine.
Continue cooking on low heat for another 30-40 minutes until leaves are tender and sauce thickens. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Season with salt to taste. Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg beef shank or brisket, cut into chunks

instructions.step: In a large pot, combine beef, onion, garlic, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours until beef is tender.
Add potatoes and corn to the pot. Cook until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.
Add cabbage and green beans. Cook for another 5-7 minutes until vegetables are just cooked.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with steamed rice and a side of fish sauce with calamansi (optional).

ingredients.item: 6 pcs galunggong (round scad fish), cleaned and gutted

instructions.step: In a pot, combine vinegar, water, ginger, garlic, onion, and brown sugar. Bring to a boil.
Add the galunggong fish carefully into the pot. Do not stir to avoid breaking the fish.
Add the green chilies and season with salt and pepper.
Simmer on low heat for about 20-25 minutes or until the fish is cooked and the sauce slightly reduces.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 500g pork belly (liempo), sliced into 1-inch thick pieces

instructions.step: Season the pork belly slices with salt and pepper on both sides. Let it rest for 10 minutes.
Heat enough cooking oil in a pan over medium heat.
Fry the pork belly pieces until golden brown and crispy on both sides, about 6-8 minutes per side.
Drain excess oil on paper towels and serve hot with steamed rice and dipping sauce like vinegar with garlic and chili.

ingredients.item: 1 kg chicken, cut into serving pieces
1 cup young tamarind leaves (or spinach as substitute)
1 packet sinigang mix or 1 cup fresh tamarind juice (optional, for added sourness)
Fish sauce (patis) or salt to taste

instructions.step: Heat oil in a pot. Sauté garlic, onion, ginger, and tomatoes until fragrant and softened.
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 30–40 minutes.
Add tamarind leaves and green chilies. Let it simmer for another 5–10 minutes.
Add sinigang mix or tamarind juice if a stronger sour flavor is desired. Season with fish sauce or salt to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 medium banana blossom (puso ng saging), sliced thinly

instructions.step: Peel and thinly slice the banana blossom. Rub with salt and soak in water for 15–20 minutes to remove bitterness. Squeeze and drain well.
Heat oil in a pan. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
If using ground pork, add and cook until browned.
Add the drained banana blossom and sauté for 5–7 minutes.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Stir well.
If using coconut milk, pour it in and simmer for another 5 minutes until sauce is slightly reduced.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 tbsp calamansi juice or lemon juice

instructions.step: In a bowl, mix garlic, onion, tomato, soy sauce, calamansi juice, salt, and pepper to make the marinade.
Stuff the marinade inside the butterflied bangus and let it marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Wrap the fish with banana leaves if using, or place directly on the grill.
Grill the fish over medium heat for about 20-25 minutes on each side or until cooked and slightly charred.
Serve hot with steamed rice and dipping sauce (soy sauce with chili and calamansi).
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Sauté onion, garlic, and tomato until fragrant.
Add ground pork and cook until browned.
Add potatoes, carrots, and green peas. Stir and cook for about 5 minutes.
Season with soy sauce, fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Simmer until vegetables are tender and flavors meld.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: Salted duck eggs (itlog na maalat), store-bought or homemade

instructions.step: If raw, boil the salted duck eggs in water for about 10-12 minutes until cooked.
Let the eggs cool, then peel the shells carefully.
Serve sliced as a side dish or condiment, commonly paired with garlic fried rice (sinangag) or tomatoes.

ingredients.item: 2 pcs tinapa (smoked fish), cleaned and deboned

instructions.step: Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic until golden and fragrant.
Add flaked tinapa and cook for 2-3 minutes to heat through.
Mix the sautéed tinapa with cooked rice, season with salt and pepper.
Serve with sliced tomatoes on the side if desired.

ingredients.item: 500 grams pork tenderloin, sliced into strips
250 grams pork liver, sliced into strips
1 red bell pepper, sliced into strips
1 green bell pepper, sliced into strips

instructions.step: Heat oil in a pan. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork tenderloin and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in vinegar (do not stir) and let it boil for a few minutes to cook off the acidity.
Add soy sauce, bay leaves, and season with salt and pepper. Let simmer until pork is tender.
Add pork liver and cook for 5–7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add bell peppers and green peas (if using). Cook for another 3–5 minutes or until vegetables are tender but still crisp.
Adjust seasoning if needed. Serve hot with steamed rice.
